intro: Tapeinostelma caffrum, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
